intro: I'm a 2026 graduated comp sci student who focuses on both Web Dev, Cyber Security and Networking.

projects.title: On Going Linux Home Server Development
projects.description: I'm currently building a home server using my old Windows Desktop by installing Linux, acting as a main server for my home network.
achievements: Established a DHCP routing service on the server to connect my other device in a local network
Setup a proper network configuration for forwarding network traffic between devices to internet
Documented the entire process of setting up and decision making for the server setup

projects.title: Network Vulnerability Investigation
projects.description: A collection of CTF based demo challenges for practicing common network security vulnerabilities
achievements: Understood the Network OSI Model, how it works and what possible security threats can be caused by each layer
Created a GitHub repository to demostrate 5 common network security vulnerabilities
Documented the writeups of each vulnerability and how to remediate the threats
Continue to explore more different vulnerabilities (ARP Spoofing, TCP Flooding, etc.)

projects.title: Career Path way Mapping Tool Database Development and Automation
projects.description: A full-stack Admin Dashboard for the exiting Notion database with Machine Learning model with Natural Language Processing to explore new job roles categories from the current job market.
achievements: Participated as a Scrum Master to lead a team of 6 to build up the project from scratch
Transformed the existing Notion database into a MySQL database with proper data modeling
Designed and implemented a web interface for the admin to manage the database
Built a Backend service to perform the similarity analysis between the job roles entries with the job post from the market using NLP model
Setup a Automated Web Scraper to scrape job post from the online job board and update the database with new job roles categories
Documented the entire process of setting up and decision making for the project

projects.title: Linux Kali Investigation
projects.description: An exploration of cyber security and pentration testing through CTF compeition using Kali Linux.
achievements: Improved knowledge of Linux OS and cyber security tools
Applied ethical hacking principle, emphasing e-commerce security and data protection

projects.title: Evolutionary TSP Algorithm
projects.description: A implementation of the Genetic Algorithm to solve the Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP) with a focus on performance and scalability.
achievements: Led a 6-person team and applied the Evolutionary Algorithm with the use of python pypy interpreter to solve the TSP problem
Implemented multiple variable operators (Inversion Mutation, PMX-Crossover, Edge Recombination) to produce new generations of solutions

competitions.title: 2025 DevSoc Flagship Hackathon - 1st Place (ShopLyft)
competitions.description: A 4 day hackathon organised by UNSW's Software Development Socity, and developed a webpage with a browser extension as a one-stop automated shopping assistant.
achievements: Won the 1st Place of the whole hackathon
Automated the process of prices varying across stores by Web Scraping stock details from 3 common supermarkets
Implemented an algorithmic approach for optimal Route Generation and Natural Langugage Shoplist Input with Agentic AI

competitions.title: UNSW's AI for Progress Hackathon - Top 5 (Grade-Able)
competitions.description: A 2 day hackathon organised by UNSW Founders and developed a web extension to reorder the Google Search Results based on the website accessibility and user experience.
achievements: Won the Top 5 of the whole hackathon
Implemented and optimised a Backend service to analyse the target website's accessibility following WCAG 2.2 standards
Implemented an AI Agentic approach to analyse the accessibility using Playwright and ConnectOnion framework to automate the testing process
Implemented a Chrome Extension to reorder and tagging the Google Search Results
Implemented a Automated Report Generator to generate a detailed report of the target website's accessibility and user experience

competitions.title: Australian Signals Directorate CTF Competition - Top 10%
competitions.description: A 2 day CTF competition organised by Australian Signals Directorate and hosted in Sydney, Australia. I participated as a team member to solve the challenges and gain the top 10% of the competition.
achievements: Solved 5 Web and Pwn challenges across the whole competition, 4 OSINT challenges

competitions.title: DownUnderCTF 2023 - Top 19%
competitions.description: A 3 day CTF competition organised by DownUnderCTF and hosted in Sydney, Australia. I participated as a team member to solve the challenges and gain the top 19% of the competition.
achievements: Completed 7 puzzles with 1,175 points, got 397th out of 2073 teams

communityContributions.title: UNSW's Software Development Socity Notangle Team
communityContributions.description: An on-going society project for student to plan their weekly universty timetable with friends.
achievements: Contributed to the development with 10+ pull requests between both frontend, backend and microservices
Implemented client side features (Frontend Colour Theme, Migration Local Storage to React Query)
Implemented server side features (Server Route Refactoring, AutoTimetabler Microservice Integration)
Collaborated with the team of 13 students both in-person and online.

communityContributions.title: Arc eReuse Volunteering
communityContributions.description: eReuse is a student-led sustainability initiative that refurbishes donated computers and tech devices to reduce e-waste and give technology a second life. These devices are then redistributed to people and organisations in need.
achievements: Facilitated 30+ volunteering session (more than 50 hours) over the whole year
Led over 20 volunteers to participate in each refurbishing session
Collaborated with UNSW IT Department to rebuild Apple Mac device, re-purposeing old device for sustainability
Refuribished more than 450 different tech items for students and donated to more than 100 People from UNSW and our community
Saved more than $20,000 by refurbishing and diverted more than 500 kg of electronic waste

communityContributions.title: Australian Cyber Conference Canberra 2025 Volunteering
communityContributions.description: A 3 day conference organised by Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) and hosted in Canberra, Australia. I volunteered as a event assistant to help the conference attendees to navigate the conference venue and assist with any questions they may have.
achievements: Scheduled over 40 conference talks for the whole 2 days of the conference
Served more than 20 conference delegates by providing general conference information during the event
Contributed to the success of the conference by ensuring the attendees had a smooth experience

workingExperience.title: Gate Gourmet Japan Internship (Shifts Optimisation Project)
workingExperience.description: A month long internship at Gate Gourmet Japan to collaborate with the transport department to provide solutions and direction to reduce the problem of overtime.
achievements: Provided a short-term Excel program for skill matching and three long-term approaches to optimise the shifts allocation
Collaborated with the transport department using both English and Japanese to understand their current workflow
Implemented a Python program to extract the data from the existing system and consolidate for analysis and future Machine Learning model training

workingExperience.title: Raffles Medical Clinic Office Assistant
workingExperience.description: A part-time clinic back-office assistant to help the clinic staff to manage the clinic's daily operations.
achievements: Scheduled over 100 patient appointments, based on doctor and patient availabilities using Outlook and Excel tools
Contacted more than 100 patients for appointment reminders or time adjustments using phone call and emails
Collaborated with other clinic branches for reloading medical stocks or collecting smaples and results
Refactored the clinic document management system to improve the efficiency of the clinic's daily operations from 10 minutes to 1 minute for each patient folder

academic.summary: Focused on web development, cyber security and networking.
achievements: Going to graduate in 2026
Contributed to society project (Notangles) as a full-stack developer
Participated in multiple coding competitions and volunteering activities

academic.summary: Having interest on tech, exploring around different field in tech.
achievements: Joined multiple CTF competition
Learning fundemental knowledge of programing, network, & security
Exploring my interest on different field on Tech
